qas.question: What year was the U.S. army organized?
What group combined with the U.S. Army?
Who raised the United States Volunteers?
What year was the Canadian army organized?
What group combined with the U.S. Navy?
Who dismantled the United States Volunteers?
What is also called into the service of the Navy?

context: The task of organizing the U.S. Army commenced in <a0_0><b3_0>1775<b3_0/><a0_0/>. In the first one hundred years of its existence, the United States Army was maintained as a small peacetime force to man permanent forts and perform other non-wartime duties such as engineering and construction works. During times of war, the U.S. Army was augmented by the much larger <a1_0><b4_0>United States Volunteers<b4_0/><a1_0/> which were raised independently by <a2_0><b5_0>various state governments<b5_0/><a2_0/>. States also maintained full-time <b6_0><b7_0>militias<b7_0/><b6_0/> which could also be called into the service of the army.
